questions.text: In a medical quiz, the master asked about ASHA (Accredited Social Health Activist) is true for all except

options.label: A
options.text: ASHA is a skilled birth attendant

options.label: B
options.text: There is one ASHA worker for 1000 population

options.label: D
options.text: Provide primary medical care for minor ailments

questions.correct_answer: A. ASHA is a skilled birth attendant
questions.explanation:
Solution:

ASHA is a skilled birth attendant ASHA will counsel women on birth preparedness, the importance of safe delivery, breastfeeding and complementary feeding, immunization, contraception, and prevention of common infections, including reproductive tract infections/sexually transmitted infections, and the care of young children. But, ASHA doesn’t conduct delivery ASHA doesn’t give vaccination ASHA doesn’t prepare malaria slide

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option B – The general selection norm is one ASHA for 1000 population . In tribal, hilly, and desert areas, the model could be relaxed to one ASHA per habitation. Option C –The ASHA must be a resident of the village – a woman (married/ widowed/ divorced), preferably in the age group of 25 to 45 years with formal education up to the 10 th class, having communication skills and leadership qualities. Option D –The ASHA will provide primary medical care for minor ailments such as diarrhea, fevers, and first aid for minor injuries. She will give a directly observed treatment short course (D.O.T.S) under RNTCP.

questions.text: ASHA is introduced to the village after a training period of:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

23 days After selection, ASHA will have to undergo a series of training episodes to acquire the necessary knowledge, skills, and confidence for performing her spelled-out roles. Considering the range of functions and tasks, induction training may be completed in 23 days spread over 12 months. Hence Options A and B are incorrect periods of training. Option D – The 12 months is not the duration of training. Instead, it t is the spread period of 23 days of the training period.

questions.text: One of the villagers had enquired about some details of the vaccination to ASHA, and the ASHA provided the required information to the villager, which was gained from the training period. Who are the resource persons for the training of ASHA?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

ANM and Anganwadi worker The Anganwadi workers and ANM are the resource persons for training the ASHA.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, B, and D – These are incorrect since the medical officers are not resource persons for the training of ASHA

questions.text: The government of India has set up various indicators for monitoring and evaluating ASHA’s work. Which among the following is the “impact indicator” for the evaluation of ASHA’s performance :
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Reduction in infant mortality The “impact indicators” for the evaluation of ASHA’s work are: i. Infant mortality rate (IMR) ii. Child malnutrition rate iii. No: cases of TB/Leprosy were detected as compared to the previous year. Hence the correct answer is Option A – The reduction of IMR

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option B. Is not an indicator of evaluation of ASHA’s work since the hours of training is a constant for all ASHA’s Option C. Is one of the “outcomes indicators” of the evaluation of ASHA’s works Option D. Is one of the “process indicators” of the review of ASHA’s works

questions.text: In a village, a woman aged 22 was pregnant and gave birth to a boy child at midnight at her maternal house. If so, the concerned ASHA of that village will visit the newborn according to the specified schedule of how many days?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

42 days Home-based newborn care aimed at improving newborn survival. And ASHA is the main person involved in this. They will provide immediate newborn care in case of those deliveries that do not occur in the institution. ASHA will visit all newborns according to a specified schedule for up to 42 days of life.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Hence, Options A, C, and D are the incorrect duration of days at which the ASHA makes visits to the newborn.

questions.text: Due to the unavailability of vehicles to take the pregnant woman to the hospital for delivery, she gave birth to a baby at her home. If so, to ensure Home-based newborn care, what will be the scheduled visits to ASHA?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

0, 3, 7, 14, 21, 28 and 42 There are a total of 7 visits of ASHA in a case of home delivery, and the schedule of visits is: 0, 3, 7, 14, 21, 28 and 42

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A – Is the schedule of 6 visits of ASHA in the case of institutional delivery. Option B – Is the schedule of post-exposure vaccination for Rabies, in which 1 ml of vaccine is given by intramuscular route in the deltoid region, Option D – Is the schedule of pre-exposure vaccination for Rabies in which three doses of 1 ml are given by intramuscular route.

questions.text: In NRHM infrastructure, the ASHA is located at:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Village The ASHA is located at the village level in NRHM infrastructure, AWW , and the Village health and sanitation committee. This is for about 1000 population.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option B – The sub-center level, i.e., gram panchayat, for about 5 – 6 villages, i.e., at 5000 population consists of voluntary cleaning staff, 2 ANMs, and one male MPW. Option C – Each CHC is for a 1 lakh population, with 3 – 5 MBBS doctors, 1 AYUSH doctor, 1 Physiotherapist, and seven super specialty doctors. Option D – Each PHC is for 30,000 people, with 1 MBS doctor/AYUSH doctor, 3 – 4 nurses, a pharmacist, 1 lab technician, 1 health assistant, and cleaning staff.

options.label: C

questions.text: After delivery in the village, ASHA workers visit a mother's home to provide Home Based Post Natal Care. She does all except:

options.label: D
options.text: Look for fever in mother and child

questions.explanation:

To give vaccination ASHA workers do not give the vaccination.

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option B – It is the responsibility of ASHA to support exclusive breast-feeding by teaching the mother proper positioning and attachment for initiating and maintaining breast-feeding Option C – It is ASHA's responsibility to recognize the mother's post-partum complications and refer appropriately, e.g.,- vaginal bleeding. Option D – ASHA is responsible for looking for fever in mother and child and treating and referring appropriately.

questions.text: In our country, the government is introducing various healthcare programs. Who is in charge of evaluating the implementation of all health programs in our nation?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

ASHA It is the work of ASHA to evaluate the implementation of all health programs in our nation. She will create awareness and provide information to the community on determinants of health, such as information on existing health services. She will mobilize the community and facilitate access to health and health-related services the government provides.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A – ANM will act as one of the resource persons for the training of ASHA Option C – AWWs are also resource persons for the training of ASHA Option D - They must organize training for all health personnel

questions.text: In India, the first point of contact for people in our healthcare system is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Sub center The first point of contact for people is the sub-center since it is the peripheral outpost of the health delivery system in rural areas, which provides all primary healthcare services.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A – It is a staff of a sub-center to ensure its proper functioning. Option B – Is the first person of contact with the people since they are the basic unit of the health care system in India. Option D – The primary health center is a peripheral health service institution with little or no community involvement.

questions.text: The first person in contact with people in our nation’s health care system is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

ASHA ASHA is the first person in contact with the people since they are the basic unit of the health care system in India.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A – ANM is an Auxiliary Nurse Midwife, the resource person for the training of ASHA and is being staffed of all sub-centers Option C – AWWs are also resource persons for training ASHA workers who came after the ASHA in the case of contact with the people. Option D – MPW is the Multi-Purpose Worker, i.e., a Health worker-male of the sub-center who prepares malaria slide and one of the people to whom the ASHA will report the problems and the situations

questions.text: The details collected by the ASHA will be reported to the following:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

ANM and MPW ASHA will report to 2 people: i. ANM ii. Health worker male, i.e., MPW These are staff of the sub-center to which ASHA will report. And after that, from the sub-center, the medical officers are reported. Hence, Options A, B, and D are incorrect.

questions.text: India’s Accredited Social Health Activists program was established by the National Rural Health Mission in 2010 to improve health outcomes, particularly among women and children, and to reduce geographic and socioeconomic disparities. They are recruited and trained to work in their communities as health activists, educators, and providers of basic essential services. Which of the following work is not done by an A.S.H.A?

options.label: A
options.text: Distribution of drug kits like Oral Contraceptive Pills, Iron and Folic acid tablets, and Chloroquine tablets

options.label: B
options.text: Organizes Village Nutrition Day once a month,

options.label: C
options.text: Measures Blood pressure and Random Blood Sugar of those over 40 years old.

questions.correct_answer: D. Administers vaccines in ordinary households
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Administers vaccines in ordinary households Role and responsibilities of ASHA Take steps to create awareness and provide information to the community on health determinants. Counsel women on birth preparedness, safe delivery, and care of young children, etc. Provide primary medical care for minor ailments such as diarrhea, oral pills, ORS, and IFA tablets. Work with the gram panchayat's village health and sanitation committee to develop a health plan. Promote the construction of household toilets Inform about births and death in her village

questions.text: The National Health System’s mandate is to assist in the policy and strategy development in providing and mobilizing technical assistance to the states and in capacity building for the Ministry of Health. The first point of contact of villagers in the National health system is among the following?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

A.S.H.A The first point of contact of villagers in the National health system is ASHA workers. 1 Accredited Social Health Activist is assigned to 1000 people of the rural population( proposed – 2 per 1000population). They are selected by the local community and trained locally in delivering primary health care to the community they belong to, free of charge. By overcoming cultural and communication barriers, they provide primary health care in acceptable ways to the community.

questions.text: The National Urban Health mission would encourage the effective participation of the community in the planning and management of health care services. It would promote a community health volunteer - Accredited Social Health Activist, or a Link worker in a poor urban settlement. The former caters to a population of
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1000 - 2500 One ASHA ( Accredited Social Health Activist) or One Link worker caters a population of 1000 - 2500 urban poor, covering about 200 to 500 households . In return for the services rendered, she would receive a performance-based incentive.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a selection criterion for Accredited Social Health activists?

options.label: A
options.text: Must be the resident of the village

options.label: B
options.text: Preferably between 25 to 45 years of age

questions.correct_answer: C. Formal education upto class five
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Formal education upto class five ASHA should have a minimum formal education of up to class 10 th . Candidates who pass class 10 are generally preferred. Other Section criteria are: Be the resident of the village Married / Widowed / Divorc ed women Preferably in the age group o f 25 to 45 years Should have good communication skills and leadership qualities Adequate representation from the disadvantaged population group will ensure serving such groups better The general norm of selection is one ASHA for a population of 1000. In tribal, hilly, and desert areas, the norm could be relaxed to one ASHA per habitation.

questions.text: Who plays a vital role in selecting ASHA?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Gram Panchayat The Gram Panchayat would lead the ASHA initiative in four ways: The Gram Sabha undertakes (through the process outlined earlier) the selection of ASHA. It supports the ASHAs in their work and undertaking many health-related tasks through its statutory health committee. All ASHAs will be involved in this Village Health & Sanitation Committee of the Panchayat as members or as special invitees (depending on state laws). It develops the village health plan in coordination with ASHA. A part of the compensation incentive would be provided by/routed through Panchayats.

questions.text: How often should ASHA visit the home of aup others who are delivered in a Primary Health Center?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

6 Home Based Newborn Care scheme for reducing neonatal mortality has incentivized Accredited Divorce dalth Activists (ASHA) to visit all newborns and their mothers according to specified schedules up to 42 days of life. The incentive amounts to a total of Rs. 250 for six visits in case of institutional delivery and seven trips in case of home delivery, subject to the following: recording of the weight of the newborn in the Mother-Child Protection (MCP) card ensuring BCG, 1st dose of OPV, and DPT vaccination both the mother and the newborn are safe till 42 days of the delivery, and registration of birth has been done This will be confirmed through recording in MCP cards & ASHA visit forms.

questions.text: ASHA is involved in the distribution of
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Nishchay Rapid In-vitro Diagnostic Kits for the detection of pregnancy. ASHA is involved in the distribution of pregnancy detection kits.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A - Nikshay is TB surveillance using a case-based - web-based IT system Option B - The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare launched the “LaQshya program” to improve the quality of care in labor rooms and maternity OTs in public health facilities. Option C - Kilkari is an Interactive Voice Response (IVR) based mobile service that delivers time-sensitive audio messages (voice call) about pregnancy and child health directly to the mobile phones of pregnant women, mothers of young children, and their families.

questions.text: Who will be the depot holder for drug kits and issuing them to ASHA?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Anganwadi worker Anganwadi worker will be the depot holder for drug kits and will be issuing them to ASHA. The replacement of the consumed drugs can also be done through Anganwadi workers. Other roles of Anganwadi workers: Acting as resource persons for the training of ASHA Organizing Health Day once or twice a month AWW will update the list of eligible couples and also the children less than one year of age in the village with the help of ASHA ASHA will support the AWW in mobilizing pregnant and lactating women and infants for nutritional supplements.

questions.text: A pregnant female in a rural area goes to a sub-center near his house for routine pregnancy follow-up. As a female health worker, which antenatal services are to be provided? a. Registration of pregnancy within the first-trimester b. Scheduling four antenatal visits c. General examination like b.p, height, weight, etc. d. Providing tetanus immunization e. Identification of high-risk pregnancies and performing high-risk delivery f. Treating sexually transmitted diseases g. Referral of all deliveries to a higher center. Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

A,b,c,d The explanation for correct and wrong answers: Antenatal care provided at the subcenter is: Early registration of all pregnancies within the first trimester (before the 12th pregnancy). Minimum 4 ANC visits, including registration. Suggested schedule Associated services include general examination such as height, weight, b.p abdominal test, breast examination, and folic acid supplementation trimester). Iron and folic acid supplementation from 12 weeks, injection tetanus Treatment of anemia, etc. recording tobacco use by all antenatal mothers Minimum laboratory investigations like urine tests for pregnancy confirm hemoglobin estimation, urine for albumin and sugar, and linkages with other required tests Name-based tracking of all pregnant women for assured service delivery identification of high-risk pregnancy cases Identification and management of danger signs during pregnancy Malaria prevention in malaria endemic zones for pregnant women as guidelines of NVBDCP Appropriate and timely referral of such identified instances, which are by the capacity of the subcenter. Counseling on a diet, rest, tobacco cessation if the antenatal mother is an sm tobacco user, information about dangers of exposure to second-hand sm minor problems during pregnancy, advice on institutional deliveries, pre-birth preparedness, comp readiness, danger signs, clean and SAF delivery at home if called for provide information about provisions under current schemes and program Janani Suraksha Yojana identify suspected RTI/STI cases, provide counseling, essential management referral services counseling and referral for HIV/aids; and name-based tracking of missed and left out ANC cases

questions.text: A 25-year-old male patient comes to the Sub center. He is a known case of leprosy. He has come here for routine follow-up and to take monthly MDT. He also complains that people in the village are not allowing him to enter, beating him and treating him like an animal. What should you do as a health care worker at Sub-center?

options.label: A
options.text: Ask the patient to go to another village

options.label: B
options.text: Ask him to contact the local police

options.label: C
options.text: Provide health education to village people about leprosy and remove myths about it.

questions.correct_answer: C. Provide health education to village people about leprosy and remove myths about it.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Provide health education to village people about leprosy and remove myths about it. The explanation for correct and wrong answers: Role of healthcare workers at Sub center in the national leprosy elimination program are: H ealth education to the community regarding signs and symptoms of leprosy, its complications, curability, and availability of free of cost treatment; Referral of suspected cases of leprosy (person with skin patch, nodule, thickened skin, impaired sensation in hands and feet with muscle weakness) and its complications to PHC; and Provision of subsequent doses of MDT and follow-up of persons under treatment for leprosy, maintain records and monitor for regularity and completion of treatment.

questions.text: A list of villages and populations and the type of area is given. Please fill in whether the village is applicable for PHC or Sub-center. C 2 PHC and 13 sub enters the plains 1 PHC and seven subs enters the hilly area. options.label: A
options.text: No PHC can do cataract surgery

options.label: B
options.text: Some PHCs can do cataract surgery facility off to on a camp basis

options.label: C
options.text: Such camps are held once every month.

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Both b and c. The explanation for correct and wrong answers: Some PHCs can do selected surgical procedures : The vasectomy, tubectomy (include ing laparoscopic tubectomy), MTP, hydrocelectomy Cataract surgeries as a camp/fixed day (mostly once a month) approach have to be carried out in a PHC with facilities of o.t.

Solution:

C,d The explanation for the correct answer: As s per Indian public health standards for primary health centers. A) CBC B) AFB sputum smear examination C) Blood pressure D) ECG E) Chest X-ray F) CT –scan G) Pulmonary function test Select the correct answer from the given below.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

A,b,c, The explanation for correct and wrong answers: Essential laboratory services provided at PHC are: Routine urine, stool, and blood tests (hemoglobin, CBC, blood grouping, rh blood sugar, blood cholesterol, etc.); Bleeding time, clotting time; Sputum testing for tuberculosis (if designated as a microscopy center under Blood smear examination for malarial parasite; rapid tests for pregnancy RPR test for syphilis surveillance; Rapid diagnostic tests for typhoid and malaria; Rapid test kit for fecal contamination of water; Estimation of chlorine level of water using an ortho-toluidine reagent.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a staff recommendation in the sub-center type with facilities to conduct delivery?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

One Auxiliary Nurse Midwife Type B Sub-center has facilities to conduct deliveries. Staff recommendations in the Type B sub-center include: Two Auxiliary Nurse Midwives One Male Health worker One Staff Nurse or ANM (if Staff Nurse not available) Sanitation services should be provided through outsourcing on a full-time basis.

questions.text: A 38-week Primigravida is complaining of vaginal bleeding and severe abdominal pain. She must be taken to
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Sub Center Type B Type B sub-center will provide all recommended services, including facilities for conducting deliveries at the sub-center. They will be expected to work around 20 deliveries in a month. They should be provided with all labor room facilities and equipment, including the newborn care corner. These centers may be offered extra equipment, drugs, supplies, materials, two beds, and a budget for smooth functioning.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A - Type A Subcenters do not have the facility for conducting delivery, and patients may usually be referred to nearby centers providing delivery facilities. These Type A Subcenters should give all other recommended services and focus on outreach services, prevalent diseases, tuberculosis, leprosy, noncommunicable disease cases, nutrition, water, sanitation, and epidemics. Option C and Option D - There is no such thing called Subcenter Type C and Type D.

questions.text: A sub-center conducts around 25 deliveries in a month. Identify the type of sub-center and the ideal number of beds that should be available.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Type B, four beds Type B sub-center will provide all recommended services, including facilities for conducting deliveries at the sub-center. They will be expected to conduct around 20 deliveries in a month. They should be provided with all labor room facilities and equipment, including the newborn care corner. These centers may be provided extra equipment, drugs, supplies, materials, two beds, and a budget for smooth functioning. If the number of deliveries is 20 or more in a month, then additional two beds will be provided.

questions.text: Which of the following is the lowest rung of a referral pyramid of health facilities?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Sub Center In the public sector, a Health Sub-centre is the most peripheral and first point of contact between the primary healthcare system and the community. A Sub-centre provides an interface with the community at the grass-root level, providing all the primary health care services. It is the lowest rung of a referral pyramid of health facilities: Sub-centres, Primary Health Centers, Community Health Centres, Sub-Divisional/Sub-District Hospitals, and District Hospitals. The purpose of the Health Sub-centre is mainly preventive and promotive, but it also provides a basic level of curative care.

questions.text: A Primary Health Center in Madurai conducts an average of 64 monthly deliveries. This Primary Health center belongs to
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Type B From a service delivery angle, PHCs may be of two types, depending upon the delivery caseload: Type A PHC: PHC with less than 20 deliveries per month Type B PHC: PHC with 20 or more deliveries per month. All the services have been classified as Essential - minimum assured services Desirable - which all states should aspire to achieve at this level of the facility. There is no such thing called Type C/Type D Primary health centers.

questions.text: A Primary Health Center in Patna conducts around eight deliveries per week. Identify the PHC type and the ideal number of Staff nurses who should be employed in that PHC.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Type B, four nurses From a service delivery angle, PHCs may be of two types, depending upon the delivery caseload: Type A PHC: PHC with less than 20 deliveries per month Type B PHC: PHC with 20 or more deliveries per month. Staff Type A PHC (Essential staff) Type B PHC (Essential staff) Medical Officer - MBBS 1 1 Medical Officer - AYUSH Accountant cum data entry operator 1 1 Pharmacist 1 1 Pharmacist AYUSH Nurse midwife (Staff nurse) 3 4 Health worker (Female) 1* 1* Health worker (Female) 1 1 Laboratory technician 1 1 Health educator Health educator 1 1 Laboratory technician 1 Cold chain & vaccine logistic assistant Multi-skilled group D worker 2 2 Sanitary worker cum watchman 1 1 Total 13 14 Apart from the essential staff, the desirable staff for both Type A and Type B PHC are: One of the two medical officers (MBBS) should be a lady doctor if the delivery caseload is 30 or more per month One AYUSH medical officer to provide choice to the people where an AYUSH facility is not available in the vicinity One staff nurse/ nurse midwife and one health educator at PHC are That makes the entire staff at Type A PHC 18 and Type B PHC 21.

questions.text: You are a medical officer recently appointed in a PHC of a tribal area of Bihar. You come to know that the quality of education in the government school of your locality is poor, and you decide to take essential steps to improve the same. This comes under which principle of primary health care?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Intersectoral coordination Intersectoral coordination: Primary health care involves, in addition to the health sector, all related sectors and aspects of national and community development, particularly agriculture, animal husbandry, food, industry, education, housing, public works, communication, and other sectors.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A - Community Participation. Notwithstanding the overall responsibility of the Central and State Governments, the involvement of individuals, families, and communities in promoting their health and welfare is an essential ingredient of primary health care. Option B - The first fundamental principle in the primary health care strategy is equitable distribution of health services, i.e., health services must be shared equally by all people irrespective of their ability to pay, and all must have access to health services. Option C - Appropriate technology - it is defined as technology that is scientifically sound, adaptable to local needs, and acceptable to those who apply it and those for whom it is used, and the people themselves can maintain that in keeping with the principle of self-reliance with the resources the community and cou

questions.text: “A” is the first contact point between the village community and the Medical Officer. Which of the following is not a function of “A.”
questions.explanation:
Solution:

None of the above None of the above. Primary Health Center is the first contact point between the village community and the Medical officer. The functions of PHCs include Medical Care MCH, including family planning Safe water supply and basic sanitation Prevention and control of locally endemic diseases Collection and reporting of vital statistics Education about health National Health programs - as relevant Referral services Training of health guides, health workers, local dais, and health assistants Basic laboratory services.

questions.text: A government healthcare setup in your village caters to 30,000 people. Which of the following laboratory services is not expected to be available there?

options.label: A
options.text: Blood smear examination for malaria parasite

options.label: C
options.text: Rapid test kit for fecal contamination of water

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Urine culture and sensitivity Primary health center cater to 30,000 people in rural areas. Urine culture and sensitivity tests are available only in higher centers, not PHCs. The following laboratory services are available in a PHC: Routine urine, stool, and blood tests (Hemoglobin, CBC, blood grouping, Rh typing, blood sugar, blood cholesterol, etc.) Bleeding time, clotting time Diagnosis of RTI/STDs with wet mounting, Gram stain, etc Sputum testing for tuberculosis (if designated as a microscopy center under RNTCP) Blood smear examination for malarial parasite Rapid pregnancy tests RPR test for syphilis surveillance Rapid diagnostic tests for typhoid (TyphiDot) and malaria Quick test kit for fecal contamination of water Estimation of chlorine level of water using an ortho-toluidine reagent.

questions.text: Dr. Saumyaa works as a Medical officer in a government health set up in Chennai, which caters to a population of 50,000 people. How many hours/day is she supposed to work in OPD?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

6 hours Six hours. Urban PHCs cater to a population of 50,000 to 60,000. OPD services are for 4 hours in the morning and 2 hours in the afternoon/evening schedule will vary from state to state Minimum OPD attendance should be 40 patients per doctor per day 24-hour emergency services should be made available. They include first aid, stabilization of the patient's condition before referral, management of dog bite/snake bite/scorpion bite cases, and other emergency conditions.

questions.text: “A” is the first contact point between the village community and the Medical Officer. Which of the following is not an essential service " A " provides?

options.label: B
options.text: IEC services for the prevention of cancer

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Pap smear Primary Health Center is the first contact point between the village community and the Medical officer. Pap smear is a desirable service at PHC, not an essential service. Essential services provided at PHC about Cancer are IEC services for the prevention of cancer and early symptoms Early detection of cancer with warning signs like change in bladder or bowel habits, bleeding per rectum, blood in urine, lymph node enlargement, lump or thickening in the Nonhealing chronic sore or ulcer in the oral cavity, difficulty in swallowing, noticeable change in wart/mole, nagging cough or hoarseness of voice, etc. Referral of suspected cancer cases with early warning signals to confirm the diagnosis.

questions.text: Which of the following is an essential service to be provided by a Primary Health center?

options.label: C

questions.text: Primary Health Centres are state-owned rural healthcare facilities in India. They are essentially single-physician clinics, usually with facilities for minor surgeries, and are the most basic units of the health care system. One such Primary Health Centre is assigned in Hilly/ tribal areas for a population of
questions.explanation:
Solution:

20000 The Bhore committee in 1946 gave the concept of a primary health center as a basic health unit to provide, as close to the people as possible, integrated curative and preventive health care to the rural population, emphasizing preventive and promotive health care. As per IPHS norms, 1 PHC is established for every 30,000 populations (plains) and for every 20,000 people (tribal and hilly areas)

questions.text: Pillars of a Health care system are essential elements that enable the health care system to function and include everything from a well-managed civil service to an extensive communications system. Its framework is built on four key pillars: fostering and strengthening health and wellness care delivery. Improvement of food in Anganwadi center is considered under which pillar of Primary Health Care?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Inter-sectoral coordination Improvement of food in Anganwadi center is considered under Inter-sectoral coordination of Primary Health Care as Anganwadi is under the Ministry of Child & Women Welfare. The Declaration of Alma-Ata states, "Primary health care involves, in addition to the health sector, all related sectors and aspects of national and community development, particularly agriculture, animal husbandry, food, industry, education, housing, public works, communication, and others. "

questions.text: Pillars of a Health care system are essential elements that enable the health care system to function and include everything from a well-managed civil service to an extensive communications system. questions.text: In a community of 5000 people, the crude birth rate is 30 per 1000 people. The number of pregnant females is?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

165 N=5000 CBR = 30/1000 population No. of birth in this community = 30/1000 x 5000 =150 No. of accidental/pregnant les = 150 + 150 x 10/100 [no. of births + pregnancy wastage (10% x no. of births )]. =165

questions.correct_answer: D. Treatment of all communicable & non-communicable diseases
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Treatment of all communicable & non-communicable diseases The Alma-Ata declaration has outlined 8 essential components of primary health care: 1. E – Education concerning prevailing health problems and the methods of identifying, preventing, and controlling them. 2. L – Locally endemic disease prevention and control. 3. E – An expanded program of immunization against major infectious diseases. 4. M – Maternal and child health care, including family planning. 5. E – Essential drugs provision. 6. N – Nutritional food supplement, an adequately safe and basic nutrition supply. 7. T – Treatment of communicable and non-communicable diseases and promotion of mental health. 8. S – Safe water and sanitation.

questions.text: One sub-center in a tribal area of Orissa caters to the population of:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

3000 The sub-center is the peripheral outpost of the Indian healthcare system One subcentre caters to the healthcare needs of 5000 population in general and 3000 population in hilly, tribal, and backward areas. A subcentre provides an interface with the community at the grassroots level, providing all the primary health care services. Services provided by Sub-centre: MCH: Ante-natal, Intra-natal, Post-natal care. Child health Family planning and Contraception Adolescent health care Water quality monitoring Curative services for minor ailments like fever, diarrhea, worm infestation, etc. Prevention of malnutrition Implementation of various national health programs

questions.text: You are M.O. posted CHC Goharganj, Madhya Pradesh catering 1,20,000 lakh population. It comes under type B CHC. Which of the following features in the given options differentiate it from type A CHC?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

> 100 deliveries/ month Type A CHC and type B CHC; the major difference is the number of deliveries performed per month. Type A CHC caters to < 100 deliveries per month, while type B CHC caters to>100 deliveries per month. Other features remain the same for both types of CHC, like- The number of beds- minimum 30 beds and minimum 30 staff, but the required staff is around 54. The staff consists of- 1. 3-5 MBBS doctors,s 2. 1 Ayush, 3. 1 dentist, 4. 1 physiotherapist, 5. Seven superspecialists- OBGY (MD/diploma) Pediatrician Surgeon Medicine Aanesthesiologist Ophthalmologist PSM (MD) Hence, the answer to this question will be option C.
